title: Maintaining Narrative Coherence and Applying Principle-Based Improvisational Teaching Methods in K-12 Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of Basic Science Concepts, Inquiry Process Experience, and Digital Tool Proficiency
context.additional_context: Learners conduct scientific inquiry activities in simulation/VR environments, requiring instructors to flexibly respond to self-directed exploration beyond pre-designed narratives. Final outcomes are assessed through project-based evaluation.

learning_goals: Learners can execute instructional designs applying principled improvisational teaching methods to unpredictable situations in VR-based scientific inquiry processes at least three times.
Learners can explain five strategies for maintaining conceptual, cognitive, and cultural consistency in science storytelling, categorized by context.
Learners can document the development process of collective knowledge objects (models, question boards, experimental data) and integrate at least two into project deliverables.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
